response.overview: The film follows a young boy who is haunted by visions of the escalating crisis of climate change, feeling both the weight of the planet's plight and his own helplessness. He idolises the teachings of Don Bosco, whose legacy shows how one person's actions can catalyse meaningful change. Inspired, the boy begins to realise that waiting for "someone else" to fix things is a form of surrender - true power lies in personal initiative. Through symbolic imagery, he moves from paralysis to momentum: planting a sapling, clearing litter, rallying peers. The film underscores the message that even small acts-taken consciously and collectively-can scale into greater impact. In the end, the boy's transformation becomes a microcosm of global hope: change doesn't require perfection or grand gestures, just the courage to act to achieve.
response.title: Act To Achieve

cast.name: Mario Pimenta
